name: Compute Platform
description: Blockchain Singularity â€” all computations of the world can run on ICP. ICP is a decentralized compute platform operating as an extension of the Internet, offering cost effective compute and storage services, with infrastructure provided by independent entities around the globe. The platform allows anyone to deploy canister smart contracts on the Internet and run them in a decentralized manner.

elements.title: QUIC-based transport and P2P layer for consensus
elements.overview: A QUIC-based implementation of the transport and P2P layer for consensus that cuts down latency and increases throughput.

elements.title: Synchronous message submission endpoint
elements.overview: Providing a synchronous ingress submission endpoint in addition to the current asynchronous endpoint to reduce perceived end-to-end client-observed latency.

elements.title: Latency-aware ingress routing
elements.overview: Boundary nodes route ingress messages to subnet nodes with lower network distance in terms of latency instead of random nodes.

elements.title: Increase Stable Memory Limit to 500GiB
elements.overview: Increasing the stable memory limit of a canister to 500GiB.

elements.title: Log-structured merge tree (LSMT) storage layer
elements.overview: Rewrite the storage layer to rely on log-structured merge trees (LSMTs) instead of XFS reflinking. This will give more fine-grained control over what happens during checkpointing and thus enable further, more targeted, performance improvements.

elements.title: Support 1TB of replicated storage
elements.overview: Protocol improvements and optimizations of on-disk access and for syncing to reach 1TB of replicated state.

elements.title: Improved consensus throughput and latency
elements.overview: Improved consensus throughput and latency by better, and less bursty, node bandwidth use. Achieved through not including full messages, but only their hashes and other metadata, in blocks.

elements.title: Motoko orthogonal persistence
elements.overview: Offering simple and scalable persistence across upgrades without needing to use stable memory in Motoko.

elements.title: Asynchronous Checkpointing
elements.overview: Replicas currently persist the replicated state to disk every couple hundreds of rounds in a process called checkpointing. Currently some parts of checkpointing are done synchronously, which leads to drops in the execution rate in the checkpointing rounds and users have to wait longer for their responses during these rounds. The goal of this feature is to make more checkpointing steps run asynchronously in the background to make the IC's performance more consistent and predictable.

elements.title: Increase Stable Memory Limit to 32GiB
elements.overview: Increasing the stable memory limit of a canister from 8GiB to 32 GiB.

elements.title: HTTPS Outcalls from Canisters
elements.overview: Enables canisters to make calls to HTTP(S)-based servers. Trustless integration with Web2.

elements.title: Support 450GB replicated storage
elements.overview: Enhance replicated storage further to 450GB per subnet. Requires protocol improvements and optimizations.

elements.title: Wasm-native stable memory
elements.overview: Letting stable read and write operations directly access replicated memory, similar to how Wasm load and store operations access the the heap.

elements.title: Increase Stable Memory Limit to 48GiB
elements.overview: Increasing the stable memory limit of a canister from 32GiB to 48 GiB.

elements.title: Increase Stable Memory Limit to 96GiB
elements.overview: Increasing the stable memory limit of a canister from 48GiB to 96GiB.

elements.title: Bazel-based Build System
elements.overview: Reducing build and testing times through a Bazel-based build system. More aggressive caching. Only perform necessary steps.

elements.title: Support 750GB replicated storage
elements.overview: Enhance replicated storage further to 750GB per subnet. Requires protocol improvements and optimizations.

elements.title: Locally timing out canister requests
elements.overview: Timing out canister-to-canister messages during high load.

elements.title: High-replication Subnets
elements.overview: Subnets with higher replication factor than app subnets. Initially ~30 nodes. For highly security-critical dapps such as financial applications.

elements.title: Composite queries
elements.overview: Making queries composable so that a query can call other queries. Supported within a subnet initially.

elements.title: Canister Timers
elements.overview: Timer API to schedule tasks to be run on a canister. Improves on heartbeat API by configuring the frequency.

elements.title: Network Scalability: State Sync, Certification, and XNet
elements.overview: Improving network scalability in terms of state sync, certification, and XNet calls

elements.title: Subnet Splitting MVP
elements.overview: Subnet splitting allows a subnet and its canisters and state to be split into two subnets with minimal interruption of canisters on the subnet.

elements.title: Deterministic Time Slicing
elements.overview: A single message execution can span multiple IC rounds. Important for canister upgrades or inherently long-lasting computations.

elements.title: A subnet can support 100K+ canisters
elements.overview: Addressing the biggest bottlenecks that prevent 100K+ canisters per subnet. Important for dapps that have a canister per user.

elements.title: Improved I/O Handling in State Manager
elements.overview: Improvements of interaction with the disk in the state manager. This includes reducing the number of interactions or taking them out of the state machine loop.

elements.title: Larger Wasms
elements.overview: Allow devs to deploy and update Wasm files larger than the current 2 MB limit resulting from the ingress size limit. Achieved by chunking large Wasms and reassembling fragments before installation or update.

elements.title: Replica-signed queries
elements.overview: With this feature replicas will start signing query responses. This allows users to verify that intermediaries, e.g., boundary nodes, did not tamper with the response.

elements.title: Reassigning Nodes to Different Subnets
elements.overview: Allowing nodes to be reassigned from one subnet to another subnet through NNS proposals, without redeploying.

elements.title: Observability Solution for Nodes
elements.overview: Consensus-verified on-chain data of node behaviour. Enables monitoring availability of nodes and penalizing non-performing nodes.

elements.title: Reduction of P2P latency
elements.overview: Latency improvements of P2P messaging through improved protocol and implementation. Reduces the latency of the consensus protocol and thus improves overall performance.

elements.title: Configurable Wasm memory limit
elements.overview: Introduce an explicitly configurable Wasm heap limit. Exceeding the limit alerts the developer instead of bricking the canister when hitting the 4GiB limit.

elements.title: Best-effort messaging
elements.overview: Extend canister messaging by an additional message type that enables more scalable and responsive dApps.

elements.title: Small guaranteed-response messages
elements.overview: Extend canister messaging by an additional message type with the same guarantees as current messages with a tighter upper bound on the message size to allow for more messages that can be in flight at the same time.

elements.title: Query call metrics
elements.overview: Metrics about query calls executed for a canister during a time period. Requirement for a fair charging of cycles for query calls.

elements.title: Charging for query calls
elements.overview: Charge a fair price in cycles for executed query calls. Currently query calls are free and only update calls are charged for.

elements.title: Increasing instruction limits for query and update calls
elements.overview: Raising instruction limits of query and update calls. They have limitations of a few billion instructions currently.

elements.title: Dapp-level metrics
elements.overview: Dapp-level metrics allow for obtaining insights into statistics of dapps, e.g., the daily / weekly / monthly active users of a dapp.

elements.title: Wallet apps ("Wapps")
elements.overview: Wapps are the next evolutionary step of apps: Install your personal apps directly on the blockchain and keep control over your data.

elements.title: Support of 1M canisters per subnet
elements.overview: Allowing up to 1 million canisters on a subnet, up from the current 100K canisters.

elements.title: Support multiple TB of replicated storage
elements.overview: Enhance replicated storage further to multiple terabytes per subnet. Requires protocol improvements and optimizations.

elements.title: Canister control audit trail
elements.overview: Seamless audit trail of management actions on canisters (creation, update, deletion). Allows to trace the sequence of installed canister versions to source code through a Wasm hash.

elements.title: Improved state certification
elements.overview: The protocol requires certifying parts of the replicated state every round, which includes hashing the respective parts of the state. The faster this is, the more time can be spent on other things during the round. This feature is about optimizing certification times.

elements.title: Messages to specified canister version
elements.overview: Messages to canisters can be required to be only executed by a specific version of the call target to help guarantee that the intended (e.g., audited) version of the code is running.

elements.title: Capabilities
elements.overview: Capabilities â€” untamperable self-contained permission tokens â€” allow users or canisters to perform actions with canisters. Authority can be delegated by delegating a capability to another entity.

elements.title: Canister groups
elements.overview: Guarantee collocation of canisters on the same subnet by adding them to canister groups. Groups of canisters are always moved together between subnets.

elements.title: Secure XNet cycles protocol
elements.overview: Securely sending cycles from a less-trusted subnet, e.g., a UTOPIA subnet, rented subnet, or low-replication subnet, to a regular ICP subnet.

elements.title: Messaging model enhancements
elements.overview: Enhancing canister messaging by means such as named callbacks and one-shot messages.

elements.title: Queries at specified block height
elements.overview: Execute a query at a specified block height. Prerequisite for use cases like replicating queries on multiple replicas, XNet queries or databases.

elements.title: Hyper-scalable inter-subnet message routing
elements.overview: Hyper-scalable XNet messaging protocol and implementation supporting a practically unlimited number of subnets. The current implementation works well up to a reasonably large number of subnets.

elements.title: Canister migration
elements.overview: Migrating canisters between subnets. Important for balancing subnet utilization and scaling the IC.

elements.title: Subnet deletion
elements.overview: Enable subnets to be deleted via NNS proposals.

elements.title: Libraries for large data transfers
elements.overview: Provide more generalized abstractions to overcome message size limits and make them invisible to developers.

elements.title: Wasm deduplication
elements.overview: Deduplicating Wasm code for running many instances of the same Wasm as is done in a-canister-per-user architectures.

elements.title: Reduction of call latencies
elements.overview: Reduce call latencies for the most-used call patterns that negatively affect dapp responsiveness.

elements.title: WASI V2 support
elements.overview: WASI V2 is the upcoming standard for running Wasm programs outside of browser environments. It is expected to become the de-facto standard and be targeted by many libraries and thus should be supported by ICP.

elements.title: HTTPS outcalls V2
elements.overview: Additional feature for HTTPS outcalls: IPv4 support, single-node outcalls, and fire & forget outcalls. Allows for reduced latencies and reduced cycle costs.

elements.title: HTTPS outcalls V3
elements.overview: Support HTTPS outcalls also for queries, instead of only update calls.

elements.title: XNet composite queries
elements.overview: Extending composite queries to work also across subnets, which gives full power to composite queries and simplifies building large-scale decentralized systems.

elements.title: Capacity reservations for system calls
elements.overview: Allowing canisters to reserve capacity for certain crucial system calls such as chain-key signing or HTTPS outcalls. Reserved capacity is guaranteed to be available to the canister.

elements.title: Replica key lifecycle V2 â€” Proactive security
elements.overview: Apply key rotation or resharing to a broader range of keys managed by the replica. Improved security against temporarily compromised replicas.

elements.title: Resilience against slow nodes
elements.overview: Punishing ICP nodes that are constantly not performing to specification, i.e., failing too frequently to produce a block successfully when requested or being off-line for considerable time.

elements.title: User-paid messages
elements.overview: Using the regular gas model for specific settings: The caller, instead of the canister, pays for update and query calls.

elements.title: Subnet splitting V2
elements.overview: An enhanced version of subnet splitting where all the heavy lifting is done by the protocol.

elements.title: P2P unicast
elements.overview: Utilizing unicast at the P2P layer to communicate artefacts instead of gossip to decrease bandwidth requirements and improve throughput.

elements.title: Blob storage
elements.overview: Storage of large amounts of data in a subnet using a new blob storage architecture with the cost of around 2x the SSD cost. More efficient and cheaper compared to regular storage on ICP.

elements.title: Blob streaming (download)
elements.overview: High-throughput download of data from a subnet's blob storage. The implementation of this can have the bulk data bypass consensus when being read by a user.

elements.title: Blob streaming (upload)
elements.overview: High-throughput upload of data to a subnet's blob storage. An optimized implementation of this can have the bulk data bypass consensus, if uploaded by a user.

elements.title: Eternal storage
elements.overview: A storage tier on ICP for which a one-off payment for an unlimited storage duration instead of periodic rent is paid.

elements.title: Structured data storage
elements.overview: Library for structured data storage in stable memory to enable more powerful and convenient out-of-the-box data storage and querying.

elements.title: Inter-subnet messaging across trust zones
elements.overview: Sovereign subnets are typically more centralized than ICP mainnet. Thus, messaging between subnets needs to consider the trust zones the subnets are in to maintain overall security.

elements.title: Using cycles across trust zones
elements.overview: Transferring cycles from a sovereign network to ICP mainnet or subnets in different trust zones can, because of their weaker decentralization properties, not rely on directly sending cycles.

name: Decentralized AI
description: Today, users have to blindly trust AI models running on centralized servers with no visibility into how data is used and how AI models produce responses. Decentralized AI solves this problem by bringing the trustworthiness, security, verifiability, and resilience of smart contracts to AI applications.

elements.title: API for AI computations
elements.overview: API for smart contracts that allows them to run hardware-accelerated AI computations. Initially, hardware acceleration will rely on the CPU, paving the way for GPU hardware acceleration in the future.

elements.title: Wasm64 execution environment
elements.overview: The execution environment is lifted to Wasm64 with the benefit of a 64-bit address space and its much larger addressable memory, allowing developers to load larger models in main memory.

elements.title: Tooling and libraries for developing AI smart contracts
elements.overview: Providing developer tooling and libraries for building AI smart contracts on ICP, reusing existing AI ecosystem tools wherever possible.

elements.title: Public specification for GPU-enabled nodes
elements.overview: The ICP community needs to agree and adopt the hardware specification for replica nodes with GPUs.

elements.title: AI-specialized subnets with GPU-enabled nodes
elements.overview: AI-specialized subnets are created from nodes with GPUs and host AI smart contracts for training and inference of large models.

elements.title: Faster deterministic floating-point operations
elements.overview: Accelerating deterministic floating-point computations in the Wasm engine.

elements.title: Wasm SIMD instructions
elements.overview: Deterministic SIMD (Single Instruction, Multiple Data) support in the Wasm execution engine for better performance of AI inference.

elements.title: Optimizing AI inference engine
elements.overview: This feature brings SIMD support to the open source inference engine used on ICP to leverage the upcoming support of SIMD operations in Wasm.

elements.title: Increase the message instruction limit to 40 billion instructions
elements.overview: Increasing the message limit from 20 to 40 billion instructions to facilitate longer-running computations, which is crucial for AI inference.

elements.title: Increase the instruction limit in queries from 5 billion instructions to 40 billion instructions.
elements.overview: The goal of this feature is to bring the instruction limit of queries on par with that of update calls by introducing a way for canisters to opt in into query charging.

name: Chain Fusion
description: Chain Fusion technology enables blockchains like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana to be "fused" together with ICP to create a seamless single-chain end-user experience for multi-chain dapps. Canister smart contracts on ICP orchestrate, augment, and interact with smart contracts on other chains using advanced chain-key technology and enhance those smart contracts with ICP's special capabilities and its superior compute and storage capacity and throughput.

elements.title: Threshold EdDSA signing
elements.overview: Threshold EdDSA support using cryptographic multiparty computation (MPC). Enables trustless integrations with all chains using EdDSA on the Ed25519 curve like Solana or Cardano.

elements.title: Solana RPC canister
elements.overview: RPC canister connecting to Solana RPC providers to integrate with the Solana network. Enables two-way communication with the Solana network.

elements.title: RPC canister for Ethereum & EVM integration
elements.overview: Integration of ICP with EVM blockchains via a canister that accesses JSON RPC providers through HTTPS outcalls. Works for Ethereum and other EVM chains with RPC providers.

elements.title: Threshold ECDSA signing latency & throughput improvements
elements.overview: Reducing the latency of threshold ECDSA signing operations by reducing the number of required consensus rounds through protocol improvements. Also results in a throughput improvement.

elements.title: Chain-key ERC20 (ckERC20) tokens & ckUSDC
elements.overview: A subset of Ethereum's ERC20 tokens on ICP in the form of "twin tokens" called ckERC20 (chain-key ERC20). ckUSDC is to be among the first ckERC20 tokens.

milestones.name: Chain Fusion Supports Bitcoin ordinals and runes

elements.title: Threshold Schnorr signing
elements.overview: Threshold Schnorr signing support based on multiparty computation (MPC). Enables trustless integrations with the Bitcoin network using Schnorr-BIP340 for supporting inscriptions.

elements.title: On-chain Bitcoin block headers
elements.overview: Exposing an on-chain API to access all Bitcoin block headers to enable dapps to trustlessly access the full Bitcoin block content.

elements.title: Direct Bitcoin Integration
elements.overview: Native integration with the Bitcoin blockchain. Trustless reading from and writing to the Bitcoin network from canister smart contracts.

elements.title: Threshold ECDSA Signatures (a.k.a. Chain-key ECDSA)
elements.overview: Threshold ECDSA protocol suite based on multi-party computation (MPC). Enables trustless integrations with ECDSA-based chains.

elements.title: ECDSA key rotation and resharing
elements.overview: Periodic key rotation and resharing to improve resilience against adaptive attacks against the threshold ECDSA protocol.

elements.title: Chain-key Bitcoin (ckBTC) token
elements.overview: Twin token of Bitcoin on ICP, realized with the native Bitcoin integration and threshold ECDSA. Fast, low-fee Bitcoin transfers on ICP.

elements.title: X-chain token minter V1 (ERC20-ICP)
elements.overview: First version of the X-chain token minter bringing the ICP token to Ethereum.

elements.title: Chain-key Ether (ckETH) token
elements.overview: Ethereum's Ether token on ICP in the form of a "twin token" called ckETH (chain-key ETH).

elements.title: EVM in a canister
elements.overview: An low-fee, high-performance EVM implemented as set of canisters on ICP with trustless integration with the Bitcoin network.

elements.title: Threshold ECDSA â€” Throughput improvements
elements.overview: Improving throughput of chain-key ECDSA via multiple protocol improvements such as batching, parallel processing of crypto operations, and cryptographic protocol improvements.

elements.title: Chain-key SOL (ckSOL) token
elements.overview: Solana's SOL token on ICP in the form of a "twin token" called ckSOL (chain-key SOL).

elements.title: Oracles with signed responses
elements.overview: Adding exchange rate oracles that threshold sign their responses. Required for adoption of ICP's trustless oracles in other blockchain ecosystems.

elements.title: Chain-Key BRC20 (ckBRC20) tokens
elements.overview: A generic chain-key variant of BRC20 tokens on ICP to support ordinals.

elements.title: Direct Ethereum integration
elements.overview: Direct integration of the Internet Computer with the Ethereum blockchain enables canisters to call smart contracts on Ethereum and vice versa in a trustless manner.

elements.title: On-chain Bitcoin explorer
elements.overview: Fully on-chain Bitcoin explorer running on ICP. Adds a missing piece of decentralized infrastructure to the Bitcoin ecosystem.

elements.title: On-chain Ethereum block explorer
elements.overview: Ethereum block explorer running fully on chain on ICP. Adding a missing piece of decentralized infrastructure to the Ethereum ecosystem.

elements.title: Larger threshold for threshold signing and key backup
elements.overview: Increasing the threshold of the ECDSA signing and key backup schemes from 1/3 towards up to 1/2 by giving up some availability for stronger security.

elements.title: Threshold signing with substantially increased throughput
elements.overview: Considerably improving threshold signing throughput for threshold Schnorr & threshold EdDSA, based on a new cryptographic protocol architecture.

elements.title: X-chain token minter V2 (ERC20-ICRC)
elements.overview: Enhanced version of the X-chain token minter, generalizing the approach from ICP only to ICRC-1 tokens to be brought to Ethereum.

elements.title: X-chain token minter V3
elements.overview: A further enhanced version of the X-chain token minter, bringing ICP and ICRC-1 tokens to other blockchain networks such as Ethereum L2s and Solana.

elements.title: ICRC-1 interface for native BTC, ERC20 and others
elements.overview: Exposing an ICRC-1 interface to tokens of token standards from other networks, such as BTC or ERC20. This will make X-chain tokens on ICP more easy to use.

elements.title: Ethereum and Bitcoin optimistic logging and settlement
elements.overview: Settling a fingerprint of a canister's state to ultra-high-replication blockchains such as the Bitcoin or Ethereum networks. The first version is optimistic in that the settled value cannot be publicly verified.

elements.title: Native USDC integration through CCTP
elements.overview: Bringing USD Coin (USDC) natively to ICP via integration with Circle's CCTP (Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol).

elements.title: BTC ordinals indexer and inscriber
elements.overview: BTC ordinals indexer and inscriber running fully on chain on ICP. Adding a missing decentralized piece of infrastructure to the Bitcoin ecosystem to help it become more decentralized.

name: Privacy
description: Canister smart contracts can be used to implement privacy-preserving dapps that give users full control over their data. Leveraging cryptographic protocols, ICP enables developers to build dapps where users store and share encrypted data on-chain. Advanced cryptographic protocols will eventually allow computations on encrypted data.

elements.title: ICP integrates the vetKeys protocol
elements.overview: Implementing threshold key derivation to allow for threshold decryption and other use cases. Canisters can store end-to-end-encrypted user data.

elements.title: User-space libraries and example dapps for vetKeys
elements.overview: Implementation of libraries and examples that make it easier for users and developers to use vetKeys technology and improve the security and privacy of dapps.

elements.title: vetKeys API mock implementation
elements.overview: For facilitating the community discussions regarding the API of vetKeys, a mock implementation has been provided in a canister and used to converge to the final API.

elements.title: Disaster recovery for SEV-SNP-enabled subnets
elements.overview: SEV-SNP raises the level of security, but also makes disaster recovery harder. SEV-SNP-enabled subnets need to be made recoverable, e.g., by securely escrowing its secure enclave key material on the NNS.

elements.title: SEV Support for Replica Nodes
elements.overview: Enabling the SEV-SNP trusted computing technology for the Replica VM to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access.

elements.title: SEV-SNP-enabled ECDSA subnet
elements.overview: The threshold ECDSA signing and backup subnets are enabled with SEV-SNP to raise the protection level against data exfiltration attacks by entities with access to the nodes.

elements.title: SEV-SNP for app subnets
elements.overview: Regular app subnets receive SEV-SNP protection to make them harder to tamper with and to enable attestation of running the correct software image.

elements.title: Fully-homomorphic encryption (FHE)
elements.overview: Fully-homomorphic encryption (FHE) allows for arbitrary computations on encrypted data and only authorized parties to decrypt the result. Blockchain data privacy.

elements.title: Cryptographic multi-party computation (MPC)
elements.overview: Running MPC on the blockchain nodes allow for privacy-preserving arbitrary computations to be made, with only authorized parties learning the results.

name: Platform Decentralization
description: The security of ICP is based on the elimination of central points of control. A user interacting with ICP shall not need to rely on a single party. Besides architectural aspects, such as the edge infrastructure, this also encompasses operational aspects, complementing the DAO-based governance of ICP.

elements.title: API Boundary Nodes (NNS controlled)
elements.overview: In the new boundary-node architecture, API boundary nodes are placed under the full control of the NNS and function as the edge of the IC.

elements.title: HTTP Gateways
elements.overview: The HTTP Gateway becomes a standalone component as part of the new Boundary Node architecture.

elements.title: Community-owned HTTP Gateways
elements.overview: As part of the new boundary-node architecture, the HTTP gateway is turned into a standalone service, which is easily deployable by anyone, including end users.

elements.title: SEV-SNP-protected API Boundary Nodes
elements.overview: Security for API boundary nodes is improved using trusted execution (AMD SEV-SNP), enabling anyone to attest that the correct software is running.

elements.title: Public API Boundary Node logs and metrics
elements.overview: Anyone can analyze the API boundary node access logs to gain insights into app usage patterns etc.

elements.title: Gen 2 Replica Node Hardware Specification
elements.overview: Specification of the Gen 2 hardware for ICP nodes. Vendor independent. Includes new features such as SEV-SNP CPUs.

elements.title: HostOS upgrades
elements.overview: NNS-controlled HostOS upgrades enable also the HostOS to be kept up-to-date and security patched via the NNS.

elements.title: ICOS Boundary Nodes
elements.overview: Porting the boundary node to the replica's IC OS to simplify operations.

elements.title: Canister SEO
elements.overview: Enables dapps on ICP to be index by search engines and previewed on social media. Boundary nodes redirect requests from crawlers and bots to raw in order to avoid loading the service worker.

elements.title: Canister Deny-listing on Boundary Nodes
elements.overview: Node providers can deny-list canisters to comply with local regulations and orders. Decentralized content blocking.

elements.title: Custom Domain Names
elements.overview: Custom domain names for canisters on ICP. DNS entry of domain redirects to boundary nodes.

elements.title: WebSocket support for canisters
elements.overview: WebSocket-based communication with canister smart contracts through an IC WebSocket gateway. Enables the canister to push messages to the client.

elements.title: Certified Headers
elements.overview: Flexible certification of canister-defined response headers besides the response body.

elements.title: Secure access to ICP without service worker
elements.overview: Relying on local and remote HTTP gateways to securely access ICP dapps from the browser.

elements.title: Replica Node Storage Upgrade
elements.overview: Upgrading the storage of existing replica nodes to 32 TB of NVME SSD.

elements.title: Tooling for node provider self onboarding
elements.overview: Node provider onboarding through improved tooling and a GUI. Better UX for node provider onboarding than using the command line.

elements.title: Subnet rental
elements.overview: Anyone can rent subnets created with possibly different decentralization properties than mainnet, and have full control over the subnet's resources.

elements.title: Certification libraries
elements.overview: The libraries assist developers in managing certification at the appropriate level of abstraction, addressing the complexity of securely interacting with the IC.

elements.title: Public access to a subset of node metrics
elements.overview: Giving node providers access to a subnet of node metrics to help them find out what is failing in case of node issues.

elements.title: Off-chain observability stack for Node Providers
elements.overview: Observability solution for Node Providers to enable them to independently triage node health and take corrective action in case of problems.

elements.title: Alerting of NP in case of Node Failure
elements.overview: Alert Node Providers if one of their nodes starts misbehaving or underperforming.

elements.title: HTTP Asset Caching
elements.overview: Building on response verification v2, HTTP gateways support caching of static assets such as HTML pages, JavaScript code, and images.

elements.title: Certified queries
elements.overview: Enable certified queries by having boundary nodes send a query to multiple replicas and aggregating the signed responses. Better efficiency than fully-replicated calls, and comparable security.

elements.title: SEV-SNP-protected HTTP Gateway
elements.overview: Trusted execution (AMD SEV-SNP) enables trustless HTTP gateways, empowering users to remotely attest that the correct software image is running.

elements.title: CDN canisters on edge infrastructure
elements.overview: Read-only canisters run on the ICP edge infrastructure in a non-replicated manner, bringing read-heavy data closer to the edge, analogous to CDNs.

elements.title: Chain Name System (CNS)
elements.overview: A decentralized naming system built into the ICP that allows translating user-friendly domains into various records (e.g., A records as used in DNS or wallet addresses), while ensuring verifiability and reliability.

elements.title: Node Provider Remuneration V3
elements.overview: Improves the V2 remuneration model by considering things like different multipliers per region, nodes per data center, penalties, or remuneration based on metrics such as cycles burnt.

elements.title: Strengthened node provider checks and audits
elements.overview: Strengthening the checks of entities intending to join ICP as node providers. May also include node provider audits.

elements.title: Penalties for non-compliant node providers
elements.overview: Non-compliant node providers are penalized economically or excluded from future network participation. This creates a cryptoeconomic incentive to encourage honest node provider behaviour.

elements.title: Autonomous capacity management
elements.overview: Making capacity management of the ICP network more decentralized and autonomous, driven by community proposals.

elements.title: Community can run system tests
elements.overview: Enabling the community to run system tests for the ICP codebase, using Kubernetes as container orchestrator.

elements.title: Decentralized backup and recovery
elements.overview: Enabling decentralized backup and recovery of canisters. Recovered canisters are guaranteed to not have been tampered with.

elements.title: Decentralized virtual personhood validation
elements.overview: Scalable, decentralized, virtual proof of personhood to distinguish people from machines.

elements.title: Public contributions to IC repository
elements.overview: Allowing for contributions by the public to the IC source code repository.

elements.title: Gen 3 Replica Node Hardware Specification
elements.overview: Specification of the Gen 3 hardware for the third generation of ICP nodes.

elements.title: Rewards-driven DRE
elements.overview: Rewards-driven decentralized reliability (DRE) and capacity management on ICP.

name: Identity
description: An identity solution that is privacy-preserving, self-sovereign, and user-friendly is a fundamental building block for web3 adoption. Internet Identity provides a robust authentication solution based on passkeys, with easy onboarding and support for identity attributes while protecting the usersâ€™ privacy.

milestones.name: Signer standards in use by ICP dapps and wallets

elements.title: Identity signer standards
elements.overview: Standards that enable an untrusted relying party (e.g., canister or web app) to request a signer to sign a transaction for ICP after user approval. Alternative to II's delegation model for high-security use cases or when stable identities are required with different canisters.

elements.title: Transaction approval on Ledger's ICP app
elements.overview: Signer standards are coming to the Ledger HW ICP app. Specifically, the Leger ICP app will acquire the ability to interact with dapps that support signer standards and display ICRC-21 compatible messages to the user.

elements.title: Support II authentication to Web2 services
elements.overview: Secure, privacy-enhancing authentication for Web2 by bringing ICP's II authentication to Web2 services.

elements.title: Verifiable credentials
elements.overview: Verifiable credentials are digital representations of data (qualifications, achievements, or attributes) that are cryptographically secured and portable, enabling efficient and trustworthy sharing of personal data while maintaining privacy and control.

elements.title: SSI SDK for Relying Parties
elements.overview: We will be providing tooling, libraries and standards so that relying parties looking to integrate to ICPs VC platform can do so correctly and efficiently.

elements.title: Verifiable credentials playground
elements.overview: A dapp that introduces the concepts of verifiable credentials to prospective identity issuers and relying parties with the aim to facilitate adoption.

elements.title: Device registration via QR code
elements.overview: Registering another device for an internet identity and linking it to an existing device via scanning a QR code.

elements.title: Recovery phrase verification
elements.overview: Requiring the user to confirm a few random elements of a new recovery phrase to assure they have a copy of the phrase.

elements.title: Protected recovery phrase
elements.overview: Requiring knowledge of the previous recovery phrase in order to remove or replace it. Avoids accidental deletion / replacement of the recovery phrase, or through compromised WebAuthn key.

elements.title: II stable memory migration
elements.overview: Moving identities from heap storage to stable memory data structures. Massively increases available storage for identities and reduces risks of bricking the canister during updates.

elements.title: II archive canister
elements.overview: Archive canister for recording any changes to identities managed by II. Provides full traceability regarding IIs.

elements.title: II canister subnet migration
elements.overview: Migration of the II canister from the NNS governance subnet to another high-replication subnet.

elements.title: DoS protection based on Captchas
elements.overview: Captchas are employed to protect the creation of an unlimited amount of IIs by single entities.

elements.title: Identity creation rate limiting
elements.overview: Enforing rate limits on the number of new IIs that can be created per time interval to avoid filling up storage of the II canister.

elements.title: II metrics
elements.overview: Providing II-related metrics for the dashboard. Shows the authentication means users have to authenticate to II.

elements.title: II Temporary Keys
elements.overview: Social dapps requested that users can onboard to Internet Identity without creating passkeys to reduce friction during onboarding.

elements.title: Streamlined II onboarding
elements.overview: Streamlined onboarding experience for obtaining a new II. Crucial for bringing more end users into the ICP ecosystem.

elements.title: Alternative origins
elements.overview: Alternative origins enable domain migration for services users authenticate with. Multiple alternative origins can represent a service and users will have the same principal for those.

elements.title: Login security in stages
elements.overview: Fast onboarding to Internet Identity and deferred handling of recovery factors such as seed phrases and additional devices.

elements.title: Resident passkeys
elements.overview: Explore the potential of resident passkeys to remove the requirement for users to remember their identity numbers.

elements.title: ICP DID (Decentralised Identifier) method
elements.overview: Specify a canonical ICP DID method for DID creation, resolution, update, delegation and deletion.

elements.title: Verifiable Credentials protocol extension
elements.overview: Extension of the Verifiable Credentials protocol to allow the VC issuer frontend to participate in credentials sharing.

elements.title: Verifiable Credentials Billing
elements.overview: Billing for provisioning of verifiable credentials. Enables a business model for identity providers.

elements.title: External services authentication to canisters
elements.overview: Allowing users to authenticate to canisters via Web2-based authentication services. True Web2-Web3-X-SSO.

elements.title: Usernames instead of Anchors
elements.overview: Usernames are easier to remember and better reflect what users are used to from Web2 to identify to services.

elements.title: Decentralized KYC
elements.overview: Decentralized on-chain KYC system that provides a real-world identity backbone to ICP.

elements.title: Social recovery
elements.overview: Recovery of an identity in case the device or credentials are lost by recovering the underlying key from the user's social circle who hold key shares.

elements.title: Configurable II
elements.overview: Dapps can customize their configuration of II to meet the needs of their users and their product.

elements.title: Root domain name independence
elements.overview: Make internet identities independent of the domain II was executing in when the II has been created. Important to ensure II anchors remain accessible even if II's root domain needs to be switched.

elements.title: Identity management
elements.overview: Bringing comprehensive identity management features to II: Giving users a 360Â° view on their identities, such as their open sessions, credential sharing history, or pseudonyms used with parties.

elements.title: ZK-II (Zero-knowledge II)
elements.overview: Cryptographically privacy-preserving II, based on vetKeys, that unconditionally prevents linkability of identities.

name: Digital Assets
description: DeFi protocols, real-word asset tokenization, and other digital asset solutions are strong drivers of web3 adoption. ICPâ€™s Chain Fusion capabilities, unparalleled scalability, and the ability to serve web assets from chain opens up novel digital asset classes. Moreover, it makes ICP an attractive platform to build multi chain custody solutions and wallets.

milestones.name: Oisy, a Multi-chain Wallet Powered by Chain Fusion

elements.title: Oisy
elements.overview: Shift Oisy's ownership model to a canister-per-user model. Under this change, the digital assets for each Oisy user will reside in a user-controlled canister.

elements.title: Signer standards in Oisy
elements.overview: Oisy is upgraded to support the signer standards to foster a vibrant and diverse ecosystem of signers and relying parties. Users can then safely transact with digital assets using their Oisy wallet and signer standards compatible dApps.

elements.title: Orbit Multi custody wallet for ICP
elements.overview: Users can securely share ownership of the ICP token with a fully on-chain wallet. From simple 1-out-of-2 configurations to sophisticated approval policy rules, Orbit provides comprehensive support for secure financial transactions with a flexible user-role-based system.

elements.title: Secure canister management
elements.overview: Teams building their product vision require secure shared access to dapp control. Orbit's rule engine enables policies specifying how many users are needed to approve canister management operations like upgrades and installations, preventing a single member from seizing control.

elements.title: Orbit supports ICRC-1
elements.overview: Users can manage non-ICP tokens like ckBTC and ckETH with confidence using Orbit's advanced security features, ensuring secure multi-token management.

elements.title: ICRC-1: Fungible tokens on ICP
elements.overview: Fungible token standard for the Internet Computer, improving on the ICP token standard. Accounts using principal-subaccount pairs instead of hashed addresses.

elements.title: ICRC-2: Approve and transfer_from for ICRC-1 tokens
elements.overview: Extending ICRC-1 with ERC-20-stlye approve / transfer_from functionality, but enhanced for the IC.

elements.title: Oisy
elements.overview: Network custodial wallet for EVM blockchains. Naming derived from Open-Internet-Services-like (OISy).

elements.title: ICRC-3: transaction log for ICRC ledgers standard
elements.overview: Standard for the transaction log format for ICRC ledgers. Prerequisite for unified integration of ICRC tokens with centralized exchanges.

elements.title: On-ramp for ICP and other tokens
elements.overview: On-ramping for ICP and further tokens to simplify the onboarding experience

elements.title: ICRC-7: Basic non-fungible token (NFT) standard
elements.overview: Basic non-fungible token (NFT) standard for the Internet Computer featuring batch APIs.

elements.title: ICRC-37: Approve / transfer_from extension for ICRC-7.
elements.overview: Approve / transfer_from extension for the ICRC-7 basic NFT standard for the Internet Computer. Simplifies many scenarios by avoiding error scenarios of regular transfers.

elements.title: ICRC-3 implementation for ICRC-1 ledgers
elements.overview: Implementation of the ICRC-3 transaction log standard for the ICRC-1 ledger implementation and rollout to SNS, ckBTC, and ckETH ledger deployments.

elements.title: Rosetta for ICRC ledgers
elements.overview: Implement the Rosetta standard for ICRC-based ledgers. Enables ICRC tokens to be handled by centralized exchanges.

elements.title: Trust Wallet integration
elements.overview: Integrating ICP with the widely-used Trust Wallet project to facilitate adoption of ICP beyond the current audience.

elements.title: ICRC-4: Batch transfers for fungible tokens standard
elements.overview: Extension standard for ICRC-1 defining batch transfers for ICRC-1 tokens. Batching transactions improves throughput and can reduce cost.

elements.title: ICRC-21 canister call consent messages
elements.overview: Standard for a protocol for obtaining human-readable consent messages for canister calls.

elements.title: ICRC-22 payment request formats
elements.overview: Standard for expressing payment requests for tokens on ICP as URLs and thus also QR codes.

elements.title: Implement ICRC-21 in Ledger devices
elements.overview: The implmentation of ICRC-21 in Ledger devices will allow us to support generic transactions.

elements.title: Chain-key token (ck token) support in the ICP wallet
elements.overview: Support for chain-key tokens (ck tokens) in the ICP wallet.

elements.title: Ledger Live staking integration
elements.overview: Ledger live acquires the ability to stake ICP.

elements.title: ICRC-7/-37 NFT standard in mobile wallets
elements.overview: Bringing the ICRC-7 and ICRC-37 standards for NFTs on ICP to mobile wallets.

elements.title: Institutional custody integration for custody & staking of ICP and ICRC tokens
elements.overview: An integration of the Internet Computer blockchain with institutional custody providers to support custody and staking for ICP and ICRC tokens.

elements.title: Ledger metrics
elements.overview: This feature collects and exposes certain metrics of ledgers on the Internet Computer. Both the ICP ledger as well as ICRC-1/-2/-3 ledgers receive metrics support.

name: Governance & Tokenomics
description: The ICP has two kinds of built-in governance systems. The NNS is the DAO governing the ICP protocol. The SNS framework is a toolbox for creating DAOs that govern individual dapps. Both are open for everyone to participate and facilitate decentralized decision making. Tokenomics incentivise voting participation and ensure that DAO decisions are aligned with the long-term interests of the ICP and the governed dapps.

elements.title: Engagement platform for named neurons
elements.overview: Make information about named neuronsâ€™ voting behavior easily accessible for voters to make informed decisions whom to follow.

elements.title: Increase and facilitate active participation in SNS DAOs
elements.overview: Further increase voting activity in the SNS DAOs by introducing an easy way to find experts and follow them.

elements.title: Encouraging diligent active voting
elements.overview: Further increase voting participation of neurons that make well-founded, informed decisions.

elements.title: SNS communities portal
elements.overview: Introduce a landing page for each SNS DAO to the NNS dapp to foster the DAO communities.

elements.title: Simplify neuron following experience
elements.overview: Simplifications of neuron following in the NNS and SNS to enhance UX for governance participants.

elements.title: NNS FE Dapp Re-write
elements.overview: Replacing Flutter with Svelte for the NNS Frontend dapp. Significant speed and UX improvements expected.

elements.title: NNS spam protection (remove financial incentive)
elements.overview: Protecting the NNS against proposal spam by removing the financial incentive for such spam by allocating voting rewards differently.

elements.title: Carbon Footprint and Sustainability Policy
elements.overview: Conducting a carbon footprint / environmental impact assessment of ICP. Footprint of a subnet, source of electricity, total environmental cost of a tx on ICP.

elements.title: Service Nervous System (SNS)
elements.overview: A DAO factory that allows for proposal-based no-code creation of a DAO, including an initial decentralization swap. Available as part of the ICP governance framework.

elements.title: Community Fund
elements.overview: A first version of a community fund that provides means for the NNS community to have a "treasury" to invest in projects on ICP.

elements.title: Restriction for SNS swap participation
elements.overview: Constraining participation in decentralization swaps of SNSs based on geographic location. Includes custom disclaimers to be confirmed by users before participating.

elements.title: One-proposal SNS initialization
elements.overview: Simplifying decentralization of a dapp from two NNS proposals plus manual steps to a single proposal.

elements.title: Neurons' Fund Enhancements: Matched Funding
elements.overview: Enhancing the Neuron's Fund, e.g., to scale with swap participation by the community or having a 10% cap on participation.

elements.title: Ability to mint SNS tokens and revised thresholds for voting
Node Provider Remuneration V2
elements.overview: The remuneration scheme v2 improves on the original v1 scheme by reducing remuneration for regions having already many nodes and reducing also for additional nodes of a node provider.

elements.title: Enable ICRC-2 for SNS ledgers
elements.overview: Update the SNS framework to enable the rollout of ICRC-2 on the SNSsâ€™ ledger canisters.

elements.title: Safeguards for critical SNS proposals, including the SNS treasury
elements.overview: Additional safeguards for transferring funds from an SNS treasury.

elements.title: Update of SNS ledger parameters
elements.overview: Enables parameters of SNS ledgers, such as the SNS token name, to be updated through SNS upgrade proposals.

elements.title: Increase reward for SNS launch proposals to 20
elements.overview: Increase the reward weight of NNS proposals of topic "SNS & Neuronâ€™s Fund" to 20 to incentivize more active voting and have the same rules as for proposals of topic "Governance"

elements.title: Visual indicator of actionable proposals in the NNS dapp
elements.overview: Users will see a â€˜notificationâ€™-like indicator in the NNS dapp next to the name of different projects that show how many open governance proposals there are that the user can vote on.

elements.title: Periodic Confirmation of Neuron Followees
elements.overview: Require neuron owners to confirm their neuronsâ€™ following settings periodically.

elements.title: Governance portfolio reporting capabilities
elements.overview: Reporting functionality that allows users to obtain summary information about their neurons.

elements.title: Allow ecosystem wallets to connect to the NNS dapp
elements.overview: Allow ecosystem wallets to control tokens and governance neurons in the NNS dapp to foster an interoperable ICP ecosystem.

elements.title: Simplification of NNS neurons
elements.overview: NNS neurons have different properties, such as dissolve delay and age. Some of these properties must be in a certain relation at all times. This feature is to abstract away more of these details from the users so that neurons are easier to understand.

elements.title: NNS Neuron ID Indexing
elements.overview: Create an index of all neuron ID values, accessible through a public interface.

elements.title: Manual overwriting of following-triggered votes
elements.overview: This feature enables manual (overwrite) voting throughout the entire voting period of governance proposals even when a neuron is following another neuron.

elements.title: Improve staking user experience
elements.overview: Simplify and make the ICP staking process self-explanatory in the NNS dapp to eliminate barriers of entry for first-time users.

elements.title: Archiving of NNS proposals
elements.overview: Storing NNS proposals long term instead of deleting them after a defined time period as done currently to increase transparency and accountability of governance.

elements.title: Maintain neuronsâ€™ voting history
elements.overview: Keeping the voting history of all neurons for better transparency and accountability of ICP governance.

elements.title: Private voting
elements.overview: Private voting of neuron holders. This helps prevent leakage of information on how neurons voted to ensure that neuron holders can vote freely without fearing consequences.

elements.title: Visual indicator of actionable proposals in the SNS dapp
elements.overview: Users will see a â€˜notificationâ€™-like indicator in the NNS dapp next to the name of different projects that show how many open governance proposals there are that the user can vote on.

elements.title: SNS cycles management
elements.overview: Support better automation of top-up of cycles for SNS and SNS-managed canisters for better usability.

elements.title: Neuron fund phase II (end of investment)
elements.overview: Addresses the end-of-investment phase of the Neuron's Fund.

elements.title: Hide 0 balances for SNS tokens/neurons
elements.overview: Allow users to hide all projects from the list that they have 0 tokens or neurons in. This will make the UI cleaner, and provide a better overview of DAOs the user cares about.

elements.title: Improve staking user experience
elements.overview: Simplify and make the SNS staking process self-explanatory in the NNS dapp to eliminate barriers of entry for first-time users.

elements.title: SNS swap participation with additional tokens
elements.overview: Allow users to participate in SNS decentralization swaps with different tokens than ICP, e.g., ckBTC or ckETH. Also a combination of tokens may be applicable.

elements.title: Standalone "SNS" DAO
elements.overview: Allow creating a DAO using the SNS governance code, but without going through an NNS proposal, without NNS orchestration, and without the DAO canisters being deployed on the SNS subnet.

elements.title: Simplified SNS life cycle
elements.overview: Enhancements to the SNS life-cycle to improve the experience of SNS canister upgrades for SNS communities, e.g., through API versioning and better auditability of error messages on failed upgrades.

name: Developer Experience
description: Developer experience is an essential ingredient for developer adoption. This includes low-friction canister development and operations, expressive smart contract languages, testing frameworks, and a rich set of libraries. Beyond canister development, developer experience also encompasses an inclusive and quality-preserving protocol development.

elements.title: Canister snapshots
elements.overview: Allow for canister snapshots to be created on chain. Snapshots can be exported to and imported from off-chain storage.

elements.title: Canister logging
elements.overview: New APIs for writing and reading canister runtime logs. The logs survive upgrades and traps and ensure developers are able to record key error data.

elements.title: Canister lifecycle hooks
elements.overview: Push model for canisters receiving notifications from the ICP, e.g., when they are low on cycles. More resource efficient than periodic pulling.

elements.title: Standardized canister response codes
elements.overview: Standardize canister response codes, particularly error codes, to enable better composability of services from canister smart contracts.

elements.title: Actionable error messages and backtraces
elements.overview: Improve error messages by providing more actionable information to developers such as backtraces, error codes, and links to the documentation explaining how to fix the error.

elements.title: Cycles and instruction insights
elements.overview: Give canister controllers insights on cycles consumption of their canisters to help them optimize cycles consumption.

elements.title: Cycles Ledger
elements.overview: The Cycles Ledger replaces the cycles wallet as the recommended solution for managing cycles across projects.

elements.title: Live canister metrics
elements.overview: Expose key canister metrics in realtime that can be queried, such as a breakdown of its memory usage (heap vs. stable) or received calls per second.

elements.title: Bitcoin Integration with DFX
elements.overview: Configure and run a Bitcoin adapter on the dev machine supporting the development with the native Bitcoin integration.

elements.title: dfx Deps
elements.overview: Enable canister developers to pull third party canisters into their local environment in order to build integrations that would otherwise require building code from source.

elements.title: DFX Quickstart
elements.overview: New command that guides the developer through the steps necessary to ensure a successful deployment to mainnet.

elements.title: Asset Caching
elements.overview: Enable caching of assets served by the asset canister by giving it time-to-live information.

elements.title: SNS Quill
elements.overview: Provides all the commands developers need to build and interact with an SNS. Based on the original Quill project.

elements.title: System-wide DFX
elements.overview: Allows for running dfx as a system-wide process instead of being project specific. Makes it easier to start and stop canisters, run tests, and develop integrations.

elements.title: DFX keyring integration
elements.overview: This feature integrates DFX with the OS keyring for seamless decryption of password-protected identities.

elements.title: SNS Tooling
elements.overview: Enhance dfx for developing testing dapps for SNS-based decentralization. Code and test a swap locally, simulate it on mainnet, and manage a dapp after launch.

elements.title: PocketIC
elements.overview: The PocketIC is a canister testing system that allows to run a "pocket version" of ICP, including multiple subnets. This is the preferred way of testing dapps.

elements.title: Improved Unit Testing for Motoko
elements.overview: Brings a number of enhancements to unit testing in Motoko: Support for watch mode, VSCode extension GUI, and more.

elements.title: React Native Starter Template
elements.overview: A starter project template for React Native comprising Agent-JS for an integration with ICP.

elements.title: Motoko Base Library Enhancements
elements.overview: Community-requested data structures and functionality for the Motoko Base Library.

elements.title: Motoko Incremental Garbage Collector
elements.overview: Blazing fast new garbage collector (GC) for Motoko, based on incremental GC.

elements.title: Motoko Formatter & VSCode Extension
elements.overview: Better dev UX for Motoko in VSCode. Motoko formatter, prettier integration, and other VSCode extensions.

elements.title: Motoko let-else Binding
elements.overview: A let-else binding allows a failure block to be run in case of a binding failure. Avoid deeply nested switch statements and have more readable code.

elements.title: Motoko Dev Server
elements.overview: Live-reload environment for Motoko projects that allows for rapid prototyping and a friction-free development experience.

elements.title: New project builder and templates
elements.overview: More powerful workflows for creating new projects using dfx new.

elements.title: Motoko Stable Regions
elements.overview: Run-time-based stable memory data structures allocating memory in multiple different regions. Improves Motoko's stable memory support towards towards composable use cases.

elements.title: Chunked upload of large Wasm files in dfx
elements.overview: DFX support for uploading large Wasm files in chunks to meet message size limits. Complements replica support for large Wasm files.

elements.title: Higher-level stable memory libraries
elements.overview: Create more friendly, higher-level libraries that abstract away the complexity of working with the Stable Memory API.

elements.title: dfx Version Manager
elements.overview: The dfx version manager installs and manages versions of dfx.

elements.title: dfx extensions
elements.overview: Plugin architecture for integrating 3rd-party functionality directly into DFX.

elements.title: dfx ergonomics
elements.overview: Better developer experience when using the ICP SDK.

elements.title: Tutorials
elements.overview: More and improved tutorials for faster successful onboarding of devs into the ICP ecosystem.

elements.title: Streaming support for the Asset Canister
elements.overview: Streaming specific byte ranges of large files hosted by the Asset Canister.

elements.title: Trait-Bound canister development using Candid
elements.overview: A new way to synchronize Candid interface definitions with Rust source code that leverages the capabilities of macros and Rust's strong type system.

elements.title: IC agents for additional languages
elements.overview: Releasing IC agents for additional languages to broaden the support for languages that can interoperate with ICP.

elements.title: Mobile app IC agents
elements.overview: IC agents for the Android and iOS mobile app platforms. Simplifies building native Android and iOS apps talking to canisters.

elements.title: Specify placement subnet for new canisters
elements.overview: When creating a new canister, the subnet on which it should be placed can be specified.

elements.title: Verifiable canisters
elements.overview: Tools for devs, such as TLA+, to help them verify the correctness of their canisters.

elements.title: dfx for macOS ARM arch
elements.overview: The dfx toolchain is becoming native to the Mac's ARM-based architecture. This is necessary because the Rosetta 2 emulation layer is expected to be removed in the future.

elements.title: PocketIC shipped and bundled with dfx
elements.overview: PocketIC, the new recommended standard tool for testing of dapps, is shipped and packaged with the dfx SDK.

elements.title: Candid presentation-layer configuration
elements.overview: Candid configuration abstraction enabling type mapping from source language to destination language.

elements.title: Protocol Interface Specification evolution
elements.overview: Improving version interoperability between different versions of the Internet Computer Protocol Specification.

elements.title: Ingress deduplication
elements.overview: Enhancing ingress deduplication to use a larger 24-hour deduplication window for ingress messages compared to the current 5-minute window. Provides stronger guarantees, e.g., for financial applications.

elements.title: Easy asset creation
elements.overview: Easy and streamlined creation of digital assets (both fungible and non-fungible) through out-of-the-box-deployable ledgers. For example, the creation of a new token through a proposal, without needing to manually deploy (and manage) the corresponding canisters.

elements.title: REST- & JSON-centric interfaces
elements.overview: REST and JSON-centric philosophy of interacting with ICP. Makes it easier for Web2 devs to onboard the ICP ecosystem.

elements.title: Regulatory compliance support
elements.overview: Making it easier to write regulatory compliant dapps.

elements.title: Automatic canister top-up using Web2 payment rails
elements.overview: Allowing canisters to be topped up automatically via Web2 payment systems, e.g., credit card transfers.

elements.title: Bring Actix to the IC
elements.overview: Bring Actix, one of the most powerful Web frameworks in Rust, to the IC. We should not be rebuilding this every time we do a dapp.

elements.title: A file system on ICP
elements.overview: A file system on ICP, to avoid building or emulating one whenever needed by a dapp.

elements.title: Easily upload files to ICP
elements.overview: Upload files to the IC with a few lines of code.

elements.title: Motoko-written interactive Web UIs running in Wasm
elements.overview: Implementing interactive Web UIs with Motoko, executing in the browser in Wasm. Analogous to .NET's Blazor.

elements.title: Motoko editor support V2
elements.overview: Improved Motoko support in VSCode, e.g., outline view, unused declaration warnings, organizing imports, Prettier 3 support, and AI-driven coding assistance.

elements.title: Motoko package manager shipped with dfx
elements.overview: Integrating the Mops package manager with dfx to improve DX.

elements.title: More Motoko libraries
elements.overview: Implementing, or funding the implementation of, additional Motoko libraries of frequently requested functionality.

elements.title: Language-interoperability support in Motoko
elements.overview: Allowing the integration of libraries from other languages in Motoko (with some limitations).

elements.title: Support of popular languages
elements.overview: Supporting additional popular languages such as Dart, Java, C#, Go, or Swift, to implement canisters. Helping a broader range of devs to onboard ICP.
